intro: Leucadendron elongatum, commonly known as the silver bristle plant, is a species native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Proteaceae and is characterized by its striking silver-gray foliage and cone-like inflorescences. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique appearance makes it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. It is also valued for its ecological role in supporting local wildlife.
